intro: Nepeta galatica, commonly known as the Greek catmint, is a perennial herb native to southern Europe and western Asia. It features upright, branching stems covered in dense, gray-green foliage. The plant produces small, tubular blue or purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and well-drained soil, making it a hardy and drought-tolerant species. Its aromatic leaves and showy blooms make it a popular choice for gardens and herbal use.
